properties.areaDesc: S of Cape Lookout NC to Surf City NC out to 20 nm; S of Oregon Inlet NC to Cape Hatteras NC out to 20 nm; S of Cape Hatteras NC to Ocracoke Inlet NC out to 20 nm; S of Ocracoke Inlet NC to Cape Lookout NC out to 20 nm
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 6 at 3:55AM EST until January 8 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
properties.description:
...QUICK MOVING STORM SYSTEM TO BRING GALES TO COASTAL WATERS
TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING...

.Winds will increase quickly Tuesday morning, and Gale Force
conditions are expected by early afternoon, with winds 25 to 35
knots, with gusts 40 to 45 knots. Ahead of the cold front, winds
will be southwest, and then will turn to the west-northwest
behind the front early Tuesday night. Seas will build to 6 to 10
feet by Tuesday night. Improving conditions Wednesday.

* WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 kt with gusts up to 40 kt and seas
6 to 9 feet possible.

* WHERE...The coastal waters from Oregon Inlet to Surf City.

* WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds can cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible
hazardous conditions.  Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter
course, and/or secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

NWSheadline: GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT
